Q:
Our company has 10 computers connected by several communication links. These computers are named: Server Ironclad, Server Goldleaf, Server Mirage, Server Tempest, Server Shadowbrook, Server Silverhawk, Server Oceanview, Server Windswept, Server Eaglecrest and Server Ironbark. 
To ensure network security, we need to install monitoring devices (such as firewalls or intrusion detection systems) on some of these computers so that all communication links are monitored. 
Assume that the connections between the computers (i.e., the communication links) are bidirectional. This means that information can flow in both directions across any link. Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Ironclad is connected with Server Oceanview, Server Eaglecrest. 
Server Goldleaf is connected with Server Mirage, Server Tempest, Server Windswept, Server Ironbark. 
Server Mirage is connected with Server Shadowbrook, Server Silverhawk, Server Windswept. 
Server Tempest is connected with Server Shadowbrook, Server Silverhawk, Server Oceanview, Server Eaglecrest. 
Server Shadowbrook is connected with Server Oceanview, Server Eaglecrest, Server Ironbark. 
Server Silverhawk is connected with Server Windswept. 
Server Oceanview is connected with Server Windswept, Server Ironbark. 
Server Windswept is connected with Server Eaglecrest.

Our company has 10 computers connected by several communication links. These computers are named: Server Redwood, Server Seabreeze, Server Windswept, Server Tempest, Server Vortex, Server Brightstar, Server Glacierpeak, Server Lighthouse, Server Bluebird and Server Willowbrook. 
To ensure network security, we need to install monitoring devices (such as firewalls or intrusion detection systems) on some of these computers so that all communication links are monitored. 
Assume that the connections between the computers (i.e., the communication links) are bidirectional. This means that information can flow in both directions across any link. Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Redwood is connected with Server Seabreeze, Server Windswept, Server Brightstar, Server Glacierpeak, Server Bluebird. 
Server Seabreeze is connected with Server Windswept, Server Vortex, Server Lighthouse, Server Bluebird, Server Willowbrook. 
Server Windswept is connected with Server Glacierpeak, Server Lighthouse. 
Server Tempest is connected with Server Vortex, Server Brightstar, Server Glacierpeak, Server Bluebird. 
Server Vortex is connected with Server Bluebird. 
Server Glacierpeak is connected with Server Lighthouse, Server Bluebird. 
Server Bluebird is connected with Server Willowbrook.

Server Starfire is connected with Server Windswept, Server Firestorm.
